column4: hello, i goofed up my fstab, and so now i am in terminal. anyways, for some reason sudo nano /etc/fstab does not work, it is still write protected. I can't even chmod a+x /etc/fstab... please help
sounds like the drive is mounted ro
did you set the / drive to be mounted as ro?
actually, i accidentally made 2 drives both /dev/sda1.
um, no. ofcoarse i am, but only in tty, or terminal. how else would i be talking to you?
well, if you can't edit it with sudo, it must be mounted as ro
it currently isn't mounted at all, or so i thought. but my problem isn't accessing the drive, my problem is editing fstab, which i can access, but cannot change
i can't umount that drive, but i can see the contents, and i can even open a file using nano, for instance.
then don't try to umount it, the drive you're running on
and ricorx7 i'll be right back, im going to boot of the cd and change fstab, brb
yes, that's what you need to do
man, i appreciate the help, but how can you ask me if i am connected to the internet, when i am using an internet protocol to talk to you?
